content.title: Internship Programme Of The Wildlife Crime Control Bureau (MoEFCC)
content.department: Ministry Of Environment, Forests and Climate Change
content.details: Internship at Wildlife Crime Control Bureau provides an excellent opportunity for students/researchers to familiarize themselves with various issues related to wildlife & the functioning of the Wildlife Crime Control Bureau. The intern shall have an orientation session on the organization and would be assigned specific areas of work. They shall report to and work under the close supervision of the Head of Department.
benefits: No remuneration shall be paid to the intern.
eligibility: The applicant should be an Indian Citizen.

The applicant should be a student pursuing graduation/post-graduation/diploma in any of the following subjects - Zoology, Botany, Law, Any subject related to Wildlife Management/Conservation/Protection.
The applicant should not be in a regular job either in the Public/Private Sector.
The applicant should not be more than 30 years of age.
content.application_process: Offline. The Application in the prescribed format complete in all respects may be sent by post to The Additional Director, Wildlife Crime Control Bureau, 2nd Floor, Trikoot-I, Bhikaji Cama Place, New Delhi - 110 066. The envelope carrying the application should be superscribed 'Application for Internship for Month/Year'. The Application should reach this office 5 weeks before the proposed date of commencement of the internship.
documents_required: Copy of self-attested two proofs of identity one being Aadhar Card.
Recommendation letter of the Head of Institution in official letterhead from the academic institution where the candidate is pursuing his/her studies.
Self-attested certificates of educational qualifications etc. mentioned in the application form.

faqs.question: What Is The Wildlife Crime Control Bureau And What Is Its Purpose?
faqs.answer: The Wildlife Crime Control Bureau is a statutory multi-disciplinary body established by the Government of India under the Ministry of Environment and Forests, & Climate Change, to combat organized wildlife crime in the country.

faqs.question: Where Is The Headquarters Of The Wildlife Crime Control Bureau Located?
faqs.answer: The headquarters of the Wildlife Crime Control Bureau is located in New Delhi.

faqs.question: Does Joining Or Completing An Internship Program At WCCB Guarantee A Job In The Organization?
faqs.answer: No, joining or completing an internship program at WCCB is not an assurance for a job in the organization.

faqs.question: Are Interns Required To Sign An Undertaking Regarding Non-Disclosure Of Information?
faqs.answer: Yes, interns are required to sign an undertaking regarding the non-disclosure of information that comes to their knowledge during their internship.

faqs.question: Are Interns Allowed To Use Data Collected Or Information Gained During Their Internship In Academic Publications Or Research Projects?
faqs.answer: No, interns are not authorized to use data collected or information gained during their internship in academic publications or research projects without prior approval from the Additional Director.

faqs.question: Can An Intern's Internship Be Terminated By WCCB?
faqs.answer: Yes, WCCB may terminate an intern's internship at any point without giving any reasons as it deems fit.

faqs.question: What Activities Are Interns At The Wildlife Crime Control Bureau Expected To Undertake?
faqs.answer: Interns at the Wildlife Crime Control Bureau are expected to undertake activities as directed by the concerned Regional Deputy Director in their respective Regional Offices or by the Additional Director in case of Bureau Headquarters.

faqs.question: Is There Any Remuneration Paid To Interns At The Wildlife Crime Control Bureau?
faqs.answer: No, there is no remuneration paid to interns at the Wildlife Crime Control Bureau.

faqs.question: How Often Does The Selection Committee For Internship At The Wildlife Crime Control Bureau Meet?
faqs.answer: The Selection Committee for internship at the Wildlife Crime Control Bureau meets two times in a year.

faqs.question: Who Decides The Composition Of The Selection Committee For Internship At The Wildlife Crime Control Bureau?
faqs.answer: The composition of the Selection Committee for an internship at the Wildlife Crime Control Bureau is decided by the Additional Director.

faqs.question: What Is The Selection Procedure For Internship At The Wildlife Crime Control Bureau?
faqs.answer: The selection procedure for internship at the Wildlife Crime Control Bureau involves scrutiny of applications by a Selection Committee, with due importance given to the academic performance of the applicant. The meeting of the Selection Committee is held two times in a year, and its decision is final and binding.

faqs.question: How Does The Wildlife Crime Control Bureau Assist The Customs Authorities In Inspecting Consignments Of Flora & Fauna?
faqs.answer: The Wildlife Crime Control Bureau assists and advises the Customs authorities in the inspection of consignments of flora & fauna as per the provisions of the Wildlife Protection Act, CITES, and EXIM Policy governing such an item.

faqs.question: What Role Does The Wildlife Crime Control Bureau Play In Advising The Government Of India On Issues Relating To Wildlife Crimes?
faqs.answer: The Wildlife Crime Control Bureau advises the Government of India on issues relating to wildlife crimes having national and international ramifications, relevant policy, and laws.
